issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: manage tags from aws image landing not launching dialog

comments.body: I just ran this in Chrome and it came up fine (euca login)

here's a stack trace. 

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'clone' of undefined :8888/js/views/dialogs/edittags.js:16
EucaDialogView.extend.initialize :8888/js/views/dialogs/edittags.js:16
Backbone.View :8888/lib/backbone-1.0.js:988
child :8888/lib/backbone-1.0.js:1532
child :8888/lib/backbone-1.0.js:1532
(anonymous function) :8888/js/app.js:6
context.execCb require.js:1604
Module.check
[~jloza], [~dkavanagh]: I suspect the manage tags action would fail if the user isn't the owner of the image.  Not sure though.  Could we confirm what the expected behavior is here?

I am not sure how that works, perhaps [~sjones] or [~neil] knows (although I suspect you are right), but if the user is only allowed to manage tags for images owned by their account then the menu option for manage tags should be grayed out when an image is selected that is owned by not-their-account. Sounds like an easy fix.

according to aws documentation: "You can tag public or shared resources, but the tags you assign are available only to your AWS account and not to the other accounts sharing the resource."

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/Using_Tags.html
I can add tags to amazon owned public images in the aws console, FWIW, so i would assume this should work in our console as well.
You should be able to tag images you can see (which may or may not be public)
Dug into this but unable to implement a fix.  Will need to escalate to [~jpommer] or [~eans] to fix.
verified this works in feature branch. if checked for regressions this is good to merge.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/150

The expanded rows are missing the kernel and ramdisk information. Filing another bug. But, this merge is good for reviving the "edit tag" dialog and displaying the basic image information on the expanded rows.
Verified ability to tag AWS images.
